pages.title: Redstone Port
pages.text: The Redstone Port allows you to automate your Reactor using Redstone.$(br2)Open the Port graphical interface to configure it. You can then choose between three input settings (that listen for a Redstone signal) and six output ones (that emit a Redstone signal).

$(bold)Input settings$()$(br2)Perform one of the following actions when a Redstone signal is received$(br2)$(li)$(o)On / Off :$() turn the Reactor on or off depending on the signal received$(li)$(o)Eject Waste :$() eject waste material to Access Ports in outlet mode$(li)$(o)Control Rods Insertion :$() set the insertion percentage of all Control Rods in the Reactor.

$(bold)Output settings$()$(br2)Emit a Redstone signal when one of the following conditions are meet$(br2)$(li)$(o)Casing heat :$() the heat of the Reactor Casing is above, below or in between a given temperature$(li)$(o)Core heat :$() the heat of the Reactor Core is above, below or in between a given temperature$(li)$(o)Fuel Richness :$() the Fuel Richness percentile is above, below or in between a given value

$(li)$(o)Fuel Amount :$() the amount of fuel available is above, below or in between a given value$(li)$(o)Waste Amount :$() the amount of waste available is above, below or in between a given value.$(li)$(o)Energy Stored :$() the amount of energy stored in the internal energy buffer is above, below or in between a given value.$(li)$(o)Coolant amount :$() the amount of coolant in the Turbine is above, below or in between a given value

$(li)$(o)Vapor amount :$() the amount of vapor in the Turbine is above, below or in between a given value$(br2)You will usually need two or more Redstone Ports to fully automate a Reactor.$(br2)For more complex automation, check the $(l:bigreactors:reactor/part-computerport)Computer Port$(/l).
$(l)Mandatory:$() no$(br)$(l)Valid positions:$() any face (not on frame)$(br)$(l)Variants:$() all$(br)$(l)Graphical interface:$() yes
